intro: Lithocarpus kontumensis, commonly known as Kontum stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to the tropical rainforests of Vietnam. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces hard, woody fruits that contain a single seed. Lithocarpus kontumensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest for botanical research.
